about_the_game:
Spaceship is a short technical demo showcasing high-end visual effects of the Unity game engine.

You will play a 5-minute long first-person narrative sequence: While escaping an alien attack, your spaceship has warped into uncertain space and you need to find an escape route, before your pursuers catch up with you. Roaming into the spaceship, and Interacting with holographic terminals maps, you need to find a way to land into safe space... or is it already too late?

You can run the demo using different graphics quality levels and test some graphics features of Unity High Definition Render Pipeline. Also, we provide a benchmark mode that runs a simulation of the demo and reports simple results.

If you are interested on how the project was made, you can also download the full Unity project to learn, mod, reuse, or explore the content. It is available as open-source directly on GitHub.
detailed_description:
Spaceship is a short technical demo showcasing high-end visual effects of the Unity game engine.

You will play a 5-minute long first-person narrative sequence: While escaping an alien attack, your spaceship has warped into uncertain space and you need to find an escape route, before your pursuers catch up with you. Roaming into the spaceship, and Interacting with holographic terminals maps, you need to find a way to land into safe space... or is it already too late?

You can run the demo using different graphics quality levels and test some graphics features of Unity High Definition Render Pipeline. Also, we provide a benchmark mode that runs a simulation of the demo and reports simple results.

If you are interested on how the project was made, you can also download the full Unity project to learn, mod, reuse, or explore the content. It is available as open-source directly on GitHub.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu LTS 20.04 (64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i5-4460, AMD FX™-6300, or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 760 or AMD Radeon™ R7 260x with 2GB Video RAM, or better
  • Storage: 1100 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Vulkan Support Required
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Ubuntu LTS 20.04 (64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i7-3770, AMD FX™-9590, or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 1660 with 8GB VRAM, AMD Radeon™ RX 580 with 8GB VRAM, or better
  • Storage: 1100 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Vulkan Support Required

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: MacOS 10.14
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i5-4460, AMD FX™-6300, or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon Graphics
  • Storage: 1100 MB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: MacOS 10.15
  • Processor: Apple M1
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: M1 Graphics
  • Storage: 1100 MB available space

name: Spaceship - Visual Effect Graph Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 (64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i5-4460, AMD FX™-6300, or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 760 or AMD Radeon™ R7 260x with 2GB Video RAM, or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1100 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 (64-bit)
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i7-3770, AMD FX™-9590, or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 1660 with 8GB VRAM, AMD Radeon™ RX 580 with 8GB VRAM, or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1100 MB available space

short_description: Spaceship is a small-scale technical demo showcasing high-end rendering of the Unity Game Engine. It presents a 5 minute long sequence of narrative first-person game play, You can also download the open-source project and open it using Unity Editor to learn how it was made.
